results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: Horse breaking
results.creator_credit: Agrifilm and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Depicts 72 year-old Kel Jeffrey applying his unique and humane method of gaining a horse’s confidence to the point where it will allow a saddle to be placed on its back and a person to ride it.

results.title: Adventure Games in the Classroom
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Outlines how to integrate the computer into the classroom by using an adventure games approach. The emphasis is on situations where only one computer per class is available.

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O'Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O’Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston, Julie Ruth and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.

results.title: Eye of the octopus
results.creator_credit: James Siers, Judy Siers and Sierpinski Films
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of a 13 year old New Zealand boy who lives for a summer with the people of Kiribati, a remote Pacific island and learns their customs. He learns fishing, snorkelling, sailing, and survival techniques. Finally he must capture and kill an octopus in the customary manner.

results.title: The Work prejudice film
results.creator_credit: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the stereotypes surrounding the world of work relevant to an American situation. Documentation and humour are used to motivate the young person who faces 25 to 45 years in the workforce. Narrated by Robert Vaughn. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Devrim
results.creator_credit: Amelia Flores, Mandy King, Zynet Kesting and Migrant Women's Film Group
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of a young Turkish woman who finds herself in an impossible marriage. Explores her dilemmas, her conditioning both as a migrant and as a woman, and shows how she eventually deals with these. The program is told from a migrant’s perspective, having been written, produced and directed by a group of six migrant women from different countries and backgrounds. Raises issues about migrant women’s lives in Australia, particularly domestic violence.

results.title: No. 1 On the Charts : A Look at the Australian Pop Music Industry
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Lee Simon, Basia Bonkowski, Jane Clifton and Michael Gudinski are interviewed in a forum style program about their views on the presentation of popular culture in the media. Video clips are interposed throughout the program.
